cost_breakdown.reasons: Excellent balance of safety, comfort, and efficiency. The trajectory maintains a centered path, is very smooth, and proceeds without unnecessary deviation, while ensuring a safe margin from the turning vehicle.

A good, safe trajectory that is slightly more cautious. The minor lateral deviation increases the safety margin but results in slightly lower comfort and efficiency scores compared to the optimal path.
Overly cautious trajectory. The significant lateral deviation is unnecessary, compromising path adherence, comfort due to the S-curve maneuver, and efficiency due to implied speed reduction.
Unacceptable and dangerous trajectory. It crosses the lane line to the left, creating a high risk of collision with the turning vehicle and exhibiting poor lane discipline.
A good, well-balanced trajectory, very similar to ID 540. It is safe, comfortable, and efficient, but slightly less optimal than the most direct safe path.

Poor trajectory due to excessive and unnecessary lateral deviation to the right. This maneuver is uncomfortable, inefficient, and demonstrates poor path adherence by getting too close to the lane edge.
